actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that blood donations shall be considered as charitable contributions deductible from gross income.

summary.text: Provides, under the Internal Revenue Code, that a donation by an individual of his own blood to a charitable organization shall be treated as a charitable contribution to such organization in an amount equal to $20 for each pint donated. Provides that such deduction shall not exceed $100 in the aggregate for any taxable year. (Amends 21 U.S.C. 170)

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that blood donations shall be considered as charitable contributions deductible from gross income.
